result.execSummary:
The defendant Chrystal M Kuzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentence may be transferred to Washington County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Kohl's or Breanne M.
Attend 2 self help classes/meetings per week.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.
Case 15CF527 was dismissed and read into: 14CF833 and 14CF866.
**01/20/16 COURT WILL ALLOW POSSESSION OF ALCOHOL AS IT PERTAINS TO WORK PURPOSES ONLY, SO LONG AS AUTHORIZED BY AGENT**

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - (nonworking hours) FORTHWITH. First 5 months with Huber, 67 days credit. Next 3 months to Day Report Center. Last 2 months STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time. Sentence may be served in Washington County. No Electronic Monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently serving
At a rate of $10.00 per hour to help offset court costs. As a Condition of Probation.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Chrystal M Kuzel in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Withheld sentence for 3 years Probation - concurrent to 14CF833 - Sentence maybe transferred to Washington County
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Kohl's or Breanne M..  Two self-help classes per week.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 DNA, surcharge is waived.
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the costs as a Condition of Probation.
 - 10 months jail Total Condition Time  -  (nonworking hours) commencing Forthwith. First 5 months with huber  - credit for 67 days -  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. The next 3 months to Day Report Center. The Last 2 months Stayed to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.  Sentence consecutive to any other sentence defendant is serving. Sentence may be served in Washington County. No Electronic Monitoring.
Letter filed by third party with attached family photo.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
